intro: Barleria subinermis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or red. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Barleria subinermis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
